articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES, JONATHAN J. COOPER and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: MILWAUKEE (AP) — Donald Trump, somber and bandaged, accepted the GOP presidential nomination on Thursday at the Republican National Convention in a speech that described in detail the assassination attempt that could have ended his life just five days earlier before laying out a sweeping populist agenda, particularly on immigration.
articles.title: Trump urges unity after assassination attempt while proposing sweeping populist agenda in RNC finale

articles.author: LISA MASCARO, ZEKE MILLER, MICHAEL BALSAMO and AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Critical days ahead, President Joe Biden is facing the stark reality that many Democrats at the highest levels want him to consider how stepping aside from the 2024 election to make way for a new nominee atop the ticket could be the party's best chance of preventing widespread losses in November.
articles.title: Biden's campaign faces critical moment, as Democrats encourage him to consider exiting 2024 race

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI, WILL WEISSERT and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Former President Barack Obama has a delicate balance to strike: how to weigh the mounting opposition to President Joe Biden continuing his campaign with his loyalty to his former running mate.
articles.title: Obama's dilemma: Balancing Democrats' worry about Biden and maintaining influence with president

articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — An explosion rumbled through the streets of central Tel Aviv early Friday morning after an apparent drone strike caused shards of shrapnel to rain down, injuring at least 10 people and leaving one dead, authorities said.
articles.title: Air attack leaves 1 dead, at least 10 injured in Tel Aviv

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: UMM AL-KHAIR, West Bank (AP) — First came the Israeli military bulldozers, which tore down a quarter of the homes in the West Bank Bedouin village of Umm al-Khair.
articles.title: Mounting home demolitions and settler attacks plunge a Palestinian village into crisis

articles.author: JULHAS ALAM and KRUTIKA PATHI
articles.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — Internet and mobile services were cut off in Bangladesh on Friday, following days of violent protests over the allocation of government jobs, with local media reports saying at least 28 people had been killed this week.
articles.title: Internet and mobile services cut off in Bangladesh amid violent protests that have killed 28 people

articles.author: SEUNG MIN KIM and LINLEY SANDERS
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As President Joe Biden faces a growing drumbeat of pressure to drop his reelection bid, a majority of Democrats think his vice president would make a good president herself.
articles.title: Majority of Democrats think Kamala Harris would make a good president, AP-NORC poll shows

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON
articles.description: For those conservative voters long turned off by former President Donald Trump's rhetoric, his somewhat softened tone in accepting the Republican nomination Thursday night was a welcome relief.
articles.title: Some GOP voters welcome Trump's somewhat softened tone at Republican National Convention

articles.author: YURAS KARMANAU
articles.description: TALLINN, Estonia (AP) — For three decades, European leaders have come and gone by the dozens, but Alexander Lukashenko remains in absolute control of Belarus.His longevity is due to a mixture of harshly silencing all dissent, reverting to Soviet-style economic controls and methods, and cozying up to Russia, even as he sometimes flirted with the West.
articles.title: Leader of Belarus marks 30 years in power after crushing all dissent and cozying up to Moscow

articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Bob Newhart, the deadpan accountant-turned-comedian who became one of the most popular TV stars of his time after striking gold with a classic comedy album, has died at 94.
articles.title: Comedian Bob Newhart, deadpan master of sitcoms and telephone monologues, dies at 94
